file_manager.py¶

A module for dealing with reading/writing files for NCSD code.

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.file_manager.CedarBatch(filename='batch_ncsd', params=None)¶

Subclass of FileManager, for ncsd batch files on cedar.

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.file_manager.Defaults(filename='defaults', params=<ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.DefaultParams object>)¶

Subclass of FileManager, for holding default parameters as if they were a file.

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.file_manager.FileManager(filetype, filename)¶

A general class for dealing with files, has a general write function that must be implemented for each file type.

Does not contain a general read function, you have to implement that for each different file type if you want one.

param_dict()¶

Returns a dictionary containing all file parameters

write()¶

Writes self.format_string.format(**self.param_dict()) to self.filename.

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.file_manager.LocalBatch(filename='batch_ncsd', params=None)¶

Subclass of FileManager, for ncsd batch files on local machine.

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.file_manager.MFDP(filename='mfdp.dat', params=None)¶

Subclass of FileManager, for reading / writing mfdp.dat files.

read()¶
Warning:

This is old, sketchy, and not actually used! I just kept it around in case you want to try something similar.

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.file_manager.SummitBatch(filename='batch_ncsd', params=None)¶

Subclass of FileManager, for ncsd batch files on summit.
